messages.subject: Sam Wilkinson
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you, Joanna.  I hadn t known what happened and was afraid to ask. I m so bad at keeping people, kids and lists straight and separate, and I know there
messages.messageBody:
Thank you, Joanna. I hadn't known what happened and was afraid to ask.
I'm so bad at keeping people, kids and lists straight and separate, and I
know there are a few kids amongst the unschooling folks with terminal
diseases and dangerous conditions, and I just kept my trap shut at the time
the notice was posted.

To others, the photo of Sam and his family is on the second page of photos at
the Always Learning home page at yahoo groups, end of the third row.

Here's the post Elissa sent last month:

<<For those of you who know Joanna Wilkinson, Her son Sam passed away

this weekend.

http://www.delmarvanow.com/obituaries/stories/20030122/824486.html


<<I'm sure she would appreciate a note.


*~*Elissa Jill*~*

---------------------------

And here's the obituary so you don't need to look it up:
ware
Sam Robert Wilkinson

----------------------------------------------------------------
OCEAN PINES -- Sam Robert Wilkinson, 8, of Ocean Pines, died Sunday, Jan. 19,
2003.

He was born in this area, a son of Robert H. Wilkinson Jr. and Joanna Engh
Wilkinson of Ocean Pines.

He was the brother of Carly, Jack and Jamie Wilkinson and the late Jay
Wilkinson.

His paternal grandparents are Peggy and Bill Kraemer and Robert and Alice
Wilkinson, all of Baltimore. His maternal grandparents are Fred and Michaele
Engh of West Palm Beach, Fla.

He was home-schooled and enjoyed the beach and swimming. Sam yer, he played
in Ocean City and Ocean Pines, and was a member of the MAKO Soccer League.

A funeral service will be held Thursday at 11 a.m. at the Community Church at
Ocean Pines. Interment will be in Gardens of the Pines.

In Sam's memory, contributions may be made to the "Sam Wilkinson Trust," c/o
Taylor Bank, 11103 Cathell Road, Berlin, Md. 21811.

Inquiries may be directed to Ullrich Funeral Home in Berlin.

Originally published Wednesday, January 22, 2003
